title: Do Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan hire CA articles? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for A2A. Your question is a little confusing but I’ll attempt to answer it. So companies like JP Morgan/Goldman Sacs are finance based companies which offer services related to investment banking, securities and other financial services. They don’t run articleship for CA students. Only CA firms like PWC, KPMG, Kothari and Co. have the authority to employ articles. In no circumstance your internship at Goldman sacs can be validated as articleship by the ICAI. Now if you are asking whether qualified CAs get hired at Goldman Sacs or not, then the answer is yes. Typical CA jobs at these companies are: Internal Audit and consultancy servicesProduct and Funding controller: P&L reconciliation and trading analysisAccounting control and reporting functions for various business lines the company ownsRisk control and capital management ( need3–5 years of work ex)Investment Banking IB( rare for CAs, if you are a rank holder than you can get in here. IB back office is an option for CAs but it takes long to get to the front end job)Also if you take this advise if you are attracted to finance and Investment banking jobs then CA might not be the right course for you. Best of luck!

Yes. You can pursue industrial training (i.e.3rd year of CA articleship) from these companies. But it will be difficult to get the profile of your choice. Even if you get shortlisted, they will offer you the profile they have vacancy in. But yes, you can always clearly mention your preferred field of work (in case you might get lucky enough to get that).
first of all they aren’t CA firms to hire articles 2ndly fresher CAs may get an opportunity to work with them depending upon the vacancies
Yes, but they will hire you in your 3rd year of articleship only as an industrial trainee.
